result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk: Becca. 
Case Called: 1:20 pm. 

Deft appears via video, in custody, pro se.  
Interpreter Mariana Kralewski appears via Zoom - sworn.
Court notes record reflects hearing was to be set with Judge to consider court appointed counsel.  
Counsel has not yet been appointed; Court sets hearing with Branch 4 to schedule.

SPD Attorney Status
Review hearing on August 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  9:17 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Sidney Brubacher. 
Defendant appears in person from MCJ, pro se. 
Spanish interpreter, Sally Nichols appears by video, sworn and interprets. 

Date and time set for SPD attorney status review; VRCW. 
COURT recites history of search for SPD and notes they are continuing to look.  
Defendant states he has not heard from SPD office at all.  
COURT is going to allow SPD office a little more time to find counsel. 
Defendant makes statement re: bond and states he wants to post bond today; Deft on PO hold. 

COURT directs JA to set review hearing within 15 days to see where defendant is relative to counsel. 
COURT notes if counsel is not appointed by that time, will consider court appointed counsel. 

COURT extends time limits on preliminary hearing until deft appears in court. 

Adj:  9:26 a.m.
SPD Attorney Status

Clerk: Amy.

COURT notes counsel has not yet been appointed and states numerous attempts made by SPD office. 

COURT finds good cause to extend time limits for preliminary hearing. 

COURT sets attorney review hearing for 8/04/22 at 9:15 a.m., Branch 4.

Judicial Pretrial - in court on June 22, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Non-waivable no contact with victim(s): S.H. & E.H.; No contact with minors under 18 years of age. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 2:02 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Kerri Puig for ADA Natalie Zibolski.  Defendant appears from MCJ via Zoom, with Atty Jack Mathie, in person; Interpreter Saul Arteaga appears via Zoom.

Interpreter Arteaga sworn in and interprets. 

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved.

COURT ORDERS: $5,000.00 cash bond to continue. 

CONDITIONS: 
- Same conditions as previously ordered.
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

DATES:
RH: 6/10/22 @ 1:00 p.m. Courtroom B. 
PH: 6/15/22 @ 9:50 a.m. 
JPTC: 6/22/22 @ 10:15 a.m.
CC: Branch 4.

Adjourned: 2:10 p.m.
Public Safety Assessment

3rd Probable Cause Hearing
State of Wisconsin Vs. Manalo Mendez-Famirez
Court Official: Honorable Lamont K. Jacobson.
Court Reporter: Miriam Leute
Clerk Marisa.

Case called: 2:00 pm
State appears by ADA Davis Runde.
Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty Paige Metzman.
Interpreter, Mariana Krawelski, sworn and interprets by Zoom Video.
Court notes probable cause was previously found.
State requests continuance and requests intial appearance be adjourned.
Defendant is on probation hold.
Attyorney Metzman requests bond reduction.
Court makes findings.
Court does not modify bond at this time primarily because there is a probation hold in place.
Court continues matter as requested by the State.
Court advises if probation hold is lifted then the deft should be afforded a bond modification motion.
Initial appearance set for 6/8/2022 at 2:00 pm.

Probable Cause Hearing 2
Clerk: Amanda

Case called at 2:15 pm
State appears by ada Cody Marschall. Manolo Mendez-Ramirez appears from MCJ and by Attorney Jack Mathie. Interpreter appears.
Date and time set for PC hearing; VRCW.
Interpreter Mariana Kralewski sworn and interprets.
State notes a PC was previously held and is requesting bond remain the same while law enforcement continues their investigation.
Attorney Mathie makes argument;
Defendant is on  a PO hold.
Court continues bond.
Future dates:
IA: 5/27/22 at 2:00 pm.
Adj: 2:23 pm.
Public Safety Assessment Report

Non-waivable no contact with victim(s): S.H. & E.H.; No contact with minors under 18 years of age. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.

Case called:
State appears by ADA S. Brubacher
Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty T. Peterson
Interpreter L. Salcido sworn and interprets by Zoom Video.
Attorney Peterson has not discussed with defendant due to interpreter not present.
Court finds PC.
Court sets $5,000 cash bond with conditions of non-waivable no contact with S.H., & E.H. and no contact with minors under the age of 18.
Adjourned IA set for 5/13/2022 at 2:00 pm.
Adj.
